result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Commercial Vehicle w/out Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan William Turner

records.addlTxt: Adjoining States. Signed by EFV on 04/18/22. arc    c: SCSO with complaint. e: DA .

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Erica Ellenwood, NONA by def. Case called at 8:48 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. DE does not appear. ADA Ellenwood requesting a warrant. Based on DE's non appearance, Court will issue a warrant, extraditable adjoining States. Court adjourned at 8:49 a.m.
Status conference on April 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

* AMENDED *

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jerry's Flooring.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jordan William Turner appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:10 p.m. This matter is set for a bail bond hearing. SIDE BAR. Atty Dippolito is requesting bond be amended to a signature bond. ADA Ellenwood does not object. Court will modify bond. Court finds good cause for exceeding time limits for counsel to be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Pretrial Assessment report. arc    SEALED.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jordan William Turner appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. DE will need to contact PD's Office to apply. Court reviews right to counsel with DE. DE will contact public defender for now. Court will reset for bail bond hearing tomorrow at 1 p.m. to check on status of counsel. If posts bond, must appear in person.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
